intro: Stachys anisochila subsp. zepcensis, commonly known as the Balkan betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, featuring violet or purple hues with a distinctive two-lipped structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
